item.description:
Joshua Wright on Twitter

“A lot of talk today about Commissioner Wilson’s impending resignation from the FTC. There will be plenty to say about that I am sure. But I wanted to do a short thread on and what, if any, practical implications for the agency in the near term. Here goes: (1/x)”

URL: https://twitter.com/ProfWrightGMU/status/1625577401592815616

source: Wednesday assorted links

item.title: Michelin stars make restaurants snobbier
item.description:
Ethan Mollick on Twitter

“I know this is a shock, but Michelin stars make restaurants snobby When restaurants win Michelin stars, their menu descriptions get longer, they add more references to cooking techniques, & prices go up when compared with similar restaurants in towns that Michelin does not visit”

URL: https://twitter.com/emollick/status/1625578596319338499

source: Wednesday assorted links

item.title: What is the time cost of peer review?
item.description:
Ethan Mollick on Twitter

“👀The basic infrastructure of science is breaking under the flood of research… In 2020 alone, researchers spent 15,000 YEARS worth of time reviewing articles. In the US, the time cost for reviews is equal to $1.5B, in China it is $600M, the UK is $400M. https://t.co/mpAqdHzavs”

URL: https://twitter.com/emollick/status/1625637321021313024

source: Wednesday assorted links
